questions: Q.1. Complete the sentence: Globalisation is a ___________ concept.
answers: Ans. Multi-dimensional.

questions: Q.2. State True or False. The consequences of globalisation are confined only to the sphere of politics and economy.
answers: Ans. False.

questions: Q.3. Correct and rewrite the statement: The World Social Forum (WSF) is a global platform, which brings many professors and intellectuals together.
answers: Ans. The World Social Forum (WSF) is a global platform, which brings together a wide coalition composed of human rights activities, environmentalists, labour, youth and women activists together.

Q.5. What kind of concept is globalisation?
answers: Ans. Globalisation is a multidimensional concept.

questions: Q.6. What is the basic element of Globalisation in conceptual form?
answers: Ans. As a concept, basic element of Globalisation is Flow.

questions: Q.7. List the effect of Globalisation.
answers: Ans. Globalisation has political, economical, social and cultural effect.

questions: Q.8. Which inventions were responsible for the revolution in communication?
answers: Ans. Invention of the telegraph, the telephone and microchip has revolutionised many parts of world.

questions: Q.9. Define Globalisation.
answers: Ans. Globalisation means integration of a country’s economy with the world economy.

questions: Q.10. Which technique provides base for Nationalism?
answers: Ans. Printing (sealing) technique provide base for Nationalism.

questions: Q.11. What has been possible due to technology?
answers: Ans. The ability of ideas, capital, commodities and people to move more easily from one part of the world to another has been made possible largely by technological advances.

questions: Q.12. What is Economic Globalisation?
answers: Ans. Economic Globalisation is a process which involves greater economic flows among different countries of the world.

questions: Q.13. What are the negative effects of Globalisation?
answers: Ans. Globalisation has promoted the trend of consumerism and capitalism.

questions: Q.14. What is the political effect of Globalisation?
answers: Ans. In some aspects, globalisation reduce state capacity to protect the interests of poor but in some other aspects, state capacity has received a boost also as a consequence of globalisation as enhanced technology helps states to collect the information of its citizens.

questions: Q.15. Write one negative effect of Globalisation.
answers: Ans. It has reduced the state capacity.

questions: Q.16. To what works do states limit itself?
answers: Ans. State limits itself to perform certain core functions such as the maintenance of law and order and the security of its citizens.

questions: Q.17. How do developed countries guard their National boundaries?
answers: Ans. Developed countries have guarded their borders with Visa policies.

questions: Q.18. What is the positive effect of globalisation on state?
answers: Ans. The state capacity has received a boost with globalisation. As a consequence of globalisation, with enhanced technologies available, state can collect information about its citizens.

questions: Q.19. What has been termed as ‘recolonised’ by economists?
answers: Ans. Economists call economic globalisation as re-colonisation.

questions: Q.20. How do moderate support argue in relation to globalisation?
answers: Ans. We should face the challenges of globalisation intelligently with full care.

questions: Q.21. What is Cultural homogenisation?
answers: Ans. In the name of global culture, imposition of western culture on the rest of the world is called cultural homogenisation.

questions: Q.22. What is ‘McDonaldisation’?
answers: Ans. Imprints of American culture over different cultures of world is called ‘McDonaldisation’.

questions: Q.23. What is Cultural heterogenisation?
answers: Ans. Globalisation leads to each culture becoming more different and distinctive. This phenomenon is called Cultural heterogenisation.

questions: Q.24. Why are Political right wing critics worried?
answers: Ans. Political right wing critics were concerned regarding cultural, economic and political effects of globalisation.

questions: Q.25. Why do the political left wing people criticise on the globalisation?
answers: Ans. Those on the left argue that contemporary globalisation represents a particular phase of global capitalism that makes the rich richer and the poor poorer.

questions: Q.26. Name the global platform against globalisation. Or Write full form of WSF
answers: Ans. World Social Forum (WSF).

questions: Q.27. When and where was the First meeting of World Social Forum held?
answers: Ans. The First WSF meeting was held in Porto, Alegre, Brazil in 2001.

questions: Q.28. Who all gather under WSF to oppose globalisation?
answers: Ans. Human rights activists, environmentalists, labour, youth and women activists oppose globalisation.

questions: Q.29. Write full form of FDI.
answers: Ans. Foreign Direct Investment.

questions: Q.30. Who has opposed Multinational Corporation in India?
answers: Ans. Trade unions of industrial workforce, people representing farmer interests.
